title: Ripple CTO Shares Email That Started It All - U.Today
content:
In a recent tweet, Ripple CTO David Schwartz shared the email exchange that ultimately led to him being hired by Jed McCaleb, co-founder of Ripple and Stellar. The architect behind the XRP Ledger published the email on Feb. 24 on this Twitter profile.

Advertisement

The email, dated Sept. 17, 2011, is a job application for the position of lead software engineer.

In the email, Schwartz expresses his interest in the position and highlights his expertise in cryptocurrencies and decades of development experience.

He also mentions his involvement in the Bitcoin community and his work on a Bitcoin successor. In another tweet, Schwartz said the project would have been closest to FileCoin, which is a decentralized storage network. However, he noted that the idea was in very early conceptual stages back then.

McCaleb responded to the email the following day, expressing his interest in meeting Schwartz to discuss the position further. "Yes, I've seen your posts on the forum. Your resume looks perfect for the job. We'd like to meet you to talk about it more. Do you ever come over to the bay area?" he wrote.

The exchange, which took place in September 2011, ultimately led to Schwartz being hired as the lead software engineer for Ripple. He would later be promoted to chief cryptographer, and eventually, CTO.

As reported by U.Today, Schwartz recently confirmed that he had no plans to leave the San Francisco-based company. While he has expressed interest in starting a new project from scratch, he does not want to make a perfunctory effort and does not have the passion necessary to kick off a new major project on his own.

title: PS Plus March monthly games announced: Battlefield 2024, Minecraft Dungeons and Code Vein - VG247
content:
The spread of March PS Plus games has been revealed! Those with a Plus Plus Essential subscription will be able to download Battlefield 2024, Code Vein, and Minecraft Dungeons for free starting March 7.

This was announced during the PlayStation Stay of Play in a fast-paced gameplay montage. The show also featured several new reveals, including a vast selection of new games coming to the PS Plus catalogue. If you’re keen on downloading the new PS Plus monthly games, you have until April 3 to do so.

You can watch the trailer for Battlefield 2042 season 3 here!

First up comes Battlefield 2042, a game with a troubled launch and numerous issues that have since been addressed with patches and major content overhauls in the months since. It now has classes, and the maps flow a little better than before, but it’s still got a way to go. Nonetheless, if you’ve avoided the game and are curious as to how it feels these days, a free download won’t hurt you too badly, will it?

Then there’s Minecraft dungeons, which brings the blocky crafting-heavy game to a whole new dimension with a top-down action-adventure twist. It has up to four-player co-op, a bunch of different gear pieces you can use to alter our playstyle and a good amount of character customisation too. We found it decent enough back at launch, but with new content having been released since then, maybe it’s worth another go.

Finally there is Code Vein, an anime vampire souls like with fast movement and a unique world filled with dark wonder and mystery abound. It’s got probably one of the most elaborate character customisation systems in the genre, and a blood-sucking narrative to go alongside it. We thought it was okay in our review, but it’s well worth trying if you’ve got the time.

All in all, it’s a pretty standard selection of PS Plus games this March. Let us know what you think of these three below, and if you’re planning on downloading any of them.

For more PS Plus pieces, check out our articles on the 30 best PS Plus games, as well as our full list of all PS Plus games here!

title: Ripple CTO David Schwartz: Ripple To Choose Between Its Vision and Survival - Times Tabloid
content:
David Schwartz, the Chief Technology Officer at Ripple Labs has once again dropped a hot take on the ongoing XRP lawsuit involving the United States SEC and Ripple.

This time around, Schwartz posted a cryptic message, divulging how the Silicon Valley tech company is surviving amid the longstanding heated court battle where the SEC contends that Ripple sold XRP as an unregistered security.

Also, the Ripple CEO implied that Ripple is at a crossroads as the company is faced with the decision of pursuing its vision or doing what needs to be done for survival.

Referring to Ripple, Swchartz wrote, “When a scrappy financial startup takes on a web of corruption and betrayal to bring instant payments to the masses, they learn that the cost of disrupting the status quo is higher than they could ever have imagined, forcing them to decide between their vision and their survival.”

Notably, Ripple has been fighting with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission for more than two years over the classification of the XRP token. The XRP lawsuit began in December 2020.

Considering recent comments made by Ripple General Counsel Stuart Alderoty and Attorney John Deaton, the case may not be concluded by mid-2023 as earlier speculated by Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse.

The SEC claims XRP is a security but Ripple contends that XRP’s purpose would be impaired if it is labeled a security when its functionality, liquidity, and distribution shows outright incompatible with securities requirements.

Beyond proving that XRP is not a security as claimed by the SEC, Ripple noted that they are fighting for the good of the entire crypto industry. A win for Ripple would compel the financial regulators to issue clear regulations for the emerging industry.

<

In turn, this would foster development in the crypto industry while causing blockchain developers to continue operating in the United States, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said when he criticized the securities watchdog for attacking Kraken and threatening Paxos with a lawsuit over BUSD.

Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Telegram, and Google News

title: Alec Baldwin Pleads Not Guilty in 'Rust' Shooting - Rolling Stone
content:
Alec Baldwin has pleaded not guilty to involuntary manslaughter in connection to the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the film Rust in 2021.

Baldwin entered his plea on Thursday, waiving his right to a first appearance in court, according to documents obtained by Rolling Stone. The actor remains free without having to post a bond.

He faces up to 18 months in prison if convicted of the involuntary manslaughter charge. Hannah Gutierrez Reed, who supplied the weapons on the set of the independent film, was also charged with involuntary manslaughter. On Friday, Feb. 24, she also pleaded not guilty.

According to The Associated Press, Gutierrez-Reed’s appearance included a back-and-forth over whether she should be allowed to keep a gun in her home as part of the conditions of her release. Gutierrez-Reed’s lawyer said she’d received numerous theats and had to file for a restraining order against a stalker. Her lawyer also said the court failed to properly redact some of Gutierrez-Reed’s personal information (like her phone number) when releasing court documents related to the ongoing case.

In turn, the DA objected to the gun request because of Gutierrez-Reed’s “sloppy mishandling of firearms and guns” on the Rust set. Ultimately, however, the judge ruled that Gutierrez-Reed could keep a gun at home for self defense. He also ordered that she not have any contact with witnesses who might testify during the case.

Earlier this week, New Mexico prosecutors dropped a firearm enhancement charge that could have added five years to each sentence. Attorneys for both Baldwin and Guttierez-Reed had argued that they had been incorrectly charged with manslaughter under a New Mexico firearm law that had actually been passed months after the shooting took place. A lawyer for Gutierrez-Reed told the New York Times that the updated charges “reflected good ethical standards and was correct on the facts and law.”

In a statement to the New York Times, Heather Brewer, a representative for the district attorney, said it had downgraded the charges to “avoid further litigious distractions by Mr. Baldwin and his attorneys.”

Hutchins was killed and director Joel Souza was wounded during a rehearsal on the set of Rust on Oct. 21, 2021. The incident occurred when Baldwin inadvertently discharged a prop gun that had been loaded with a live round, believing the prop had been “cold.” There have been numerous investigations into the incident by various government agencies, from the Santa Fe Sheriff’s Office to the FBI. Trending Trump Rails Against Broken Rally Teleprompters, Threatens to Stiff Contractors MTG Says Trump Is a 'Convicted Felon' Just Like Jesus Gypsy Rose Blanchard Sues True Crime Content Creator for Defamation and Fraud See Courteney Cox Reenact Moves From Bruce Springsteen’s ‘Dancing in the Dark’ Video

The shooting has prompted several civil lawsuits (as well as some fines). Most notably, Hutchins’ family filed a wrongful death lawsuit against Baldwin, Rust producer Ryan Donnell Smith, Gutierrez-Reed, assistant director Dave Halls, prop master Sarah Zachary, and “armorer mentor” Seth Kenney.

This story was updated 2/24/23 @ 2:24 p.m. ET with Hannah Gutierrez-Reed’s plea.

5. Tron (TRX) – Scalable blockchain solution available for pennies

Tron has long been established as one of the best layer-1 blockchain providers thanks to its versatile and scalable solutions, providing a compelling alternative to market leader Ethereum. Released in 2017 with the aim of decentralizing entertainment, content-sharing, and gaming, this highly-scalable blockchain has proved itself able to support high transaction throughput at lightning-fast speeds, often confirming within 3 seconds.

Developers can use the platform to support a vast range of decentralized apps (dApps). This is enabled through the platform’s Tron Virtual Machine (TVM), which provides smart contract support and easy, cheap transactions.

At the core of Tron’s quest to decentralize the web is their belief that web users should control who sees their private data, rather than having it automatically mined by big tech companies such as Meta and Google. With growing unease around big tech use of personal data, this is a truly compelling use case for Tron.

Why buy TRX?

Tron’s network is regularly used as one of the fastest and cheapest ways to transact global cryptocurrency transfers. Its high liquidity enables the platform’s excellent scalability, leading to its impressive 2000 transactions-per-second (TPS) capacity without compromising performance.

TRX was valued at $0.18 at the peak of 2021’s bull market was considerably higher than its current value of $0.062. With a dedicated user base trusting Tron as a reliable blockchain provider that consistently delivers fast transactions, TRX is one of the best crypto penny stocks to buy now.

6. Algorand (ALGO) – Proof-of-stake blockchain popular with dApp developers

Algorand is a blockchain that offers a permissionless, proof-of-stake (PoS) smart chain consensus that supports the development of dApps. It is designed to be secure, scalable, and fast, ensuring that all those participating in the network have equal influence.

The PoS consensus protocol enables total decentralization, with each node having equal authority. This allows maximum security across Algorand’s entire network and promotes full transparency, as transactions are conducted at high speed and low cost.

Algorand’s outstanding combination of excellent scalability alongside high transaction speed is the feature that makes it stand out from many of its Web3 competitors. Their stated aim is to help create a future where individuals have the tools to fully realized digital asset ownership and interact seamlessly with other web users online.

Why buy ALGO?

Three traditional issues tend to dog blockchain providers, yet Algorand’s platform has solved this infamous trio of problems. It has previously been stated that a distributed network must sacrifice either scalability, decentralization, or security to function. Algorand has achieved a network that sacrifices none of these essential functions, providing support to millions of users.

Currently available at $0.246, ALGO is one of the best crypto penny stocks presently available, with enormous potential to grow as its market-leading capability becomes known. This makes it a coin worth investing in now, with rich dividends potentially on offer for anyone who takes advantage of this current low price.

7. Ripple (XRP) – Enabling lightning-fast international transfers

Ripple aims to revolutionize the financial services industry by offering a compelling alternative to the costly and cumbersome SWIFT global payments system. With outstanding results, Ripple’s alternative has been trialed by several leading international financial behemoths, including the Bank of England, Bank of America, and Santander.

Ripple offers the same service as the SWIFT system but costs less than $0.01 per transaction and competing transfers within seconds. Widespread adoption of Ripple’s solution has been held back by a widely-publicized legal challenge to the legality of their native XRP token by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

However, this hasn’t stopped some of the world’s most prominent financial institutions, including Coinbase, and thousands of XRP coin holders from supporting the platform.

Why buy XRP?

Encouraging investment in a currency currently embroiled in a legal dispute with American government bodies appears ridiculous. However, with a decision due in mid-2023 and many experts believing the verdict will exonerate Ripple, XRP’s value will skyrocket the moment a favorable decision is granted.

With the continuing support of some of big finance’s most trusted names, a revolutionary decentralized finance (DeFi) solution that delivers enormous benefits to individuals and companies conducting cross-border business, XRP’s current value of $0.41 is unbelievable. This makes it one of the best crypto penny stocks to buy now, with potentially huge dividends to investors.

8. VeChain (VET) – Logistics solution with eco-sustainable motives

One of the questions that have dogged cryptocurrencies since their establishment more than a decade ago has been around energy efficiency and sustainability. VeChain is a blockchain network aiming to increase transparency and efficiency in logistic supply chains and, more recently, provide SaaS support for companies and governments in meeting net-zero targets.

Several big companies, including BMW, Renault, Vauxhall, PriceWaterhouseCoopers, and Walmart (China), have begun to adopt VeChain’s supply chain solutions, demonstrating the platform’s real-world viability and value.

Meanwhile, VeChain’s new carbon-neutral CO2 emission-management platform (VeCarbon) launched in 2022 and is already beginning to deliver benefits to those looking to understand their current carbon footprint and how to reduce it.

Why buy VET?

VeChain’s native VET coin is currently trading at $0.234. It will likely gain significant traction over the coming months and years as more countries and nations look for valuable solutions that deliver tangible benefits.

VeChain’s multi-use case, delivering on improving visibility and security throughout the supply-chain process, and reducing the risk of theft and fraud, is proven. Meanwhile, their move into carbon management suggests an incredibly bright future for the VET coin, making it one of the best crypto penny stocks to buy in 2023.

9. Cronos (CRO) – Native coin of crypto exchange giant looks likely to grow

Cronos (CRO) is the native coin of the crypto exchange Crypto.com, one of the biggest centralized crypto exchanges in the world. While Crypto.com’s primary mechanism is focused on trading cryptocurrencies, offering CRO coin holders access to reduced transaction fees and a range of special offers, the platform’s toolkit extends much deeper into the world of crypto trading.

Cronos leverages the power of artificial intelligence (AI) to facilitate faster transactions and lower costs. Meanwhile, the cutting-edge technology enabled by the CRO coin provides users with access to quick and easy management of their portfolios and the ability to track investments across different exchanges, thus increasing the potential for profitable returns.

Why buy CRO?

The collapse of the FTX exchange in late 2022 has opened up a massive gap in the market for other exchanges to try and challenge the market leader, Binance. Crypto.com looks exceptionally well placed to lead the charge with its wide-ranging and compelling range of features.

The CRO coin is currently valued at $0.079, which looks very low for a currency that offers such rich utility, a vast user base, and a compelling existing catalog of features. Predictions are that CRO will rise significantly in value, particularly as Crypto.com positions itself as one of the main challengers to replace FTX, making it one of the best crypto penny stocks to buy right now.
